channel.title: LibreNMS Notifications
channel.description: RSS feed for notifications to LibreNMS users

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: This is the first notification. We will post these whenever an upcoming major change is about to happen.

item.title: Important update being released
item.description: We are releasing an important update within the next 24 hours which provides some additional functionality when running daily.sh. Whilst we have done everything we can to test this across as many platforms as possible we thought it was worth letting you know.\n\nIf you notice issues with further updates after this one then please get in touch with us on either IRC or GitHub.

item.title: Poller changes
item.description: Earlier this month we released some updates which enable alpha versions of InfluxDB and MIB-based polling.\nWe have some further updates planned for the near future which may affect polling, so if you are running a mission-critical LibreNMS instance, you may wish to consider disabling updates for the time being.\nIf you notice any issues, please get in touch with us via IRC or GitHub.

item.title: Imagemagick vulnerability
item.description: A vulnerability in ImageMagick has been released, please see https://imagetragick.com/ for more details.\n\nLibreNMS uses ImageMagick for pdf generation, we advise that you add the temporary fix in on the aforementioned website until patches for your distribution are available to update ImageMagick.

item.title: Component Alerting Change
item.description: On July 25th we will be merging a PR that changes the status codes that are used for the component feature. If you have alerting rules that reference component.status, %macros.component_alert or %macros.component_normal please disable these until after the PR has been merged. Updated documentation will be merged with the PR to: http://docs.librenms.org/Extensions/Component/#alert

item.title: NUT Ups Application monitoring update
item.description:
On December 20th we will be merging a PR that fixes the polling of data for NUT Ups devices.

Unfortunately this will require users to delete the existing data and allow it to be re-created.

To do this, you can delete rrd files app-ups-nut-ID.rrd. ID will be a unique ID. After removing this file then data collection will start again.

item.title: Multimatic UPS detection changes
item.description: On December 21st we will be merging a PR that will change devices currently detected as multimatic to be detected as generex-ups.\n\nIf you have any alert rules or device groups that rely on this OS definition then you will need to update those rules to include generex-ups.

item.title: Redback SmartEdge OS change
item.description: On January 19th we will be merging a PR that will change devices currently detected as redback to be detected as seos.\n\nIf you have any alert rules or device groups that rely on this OS definition then you will need to update those rules to include seos.

item.title: Large schema update due to be released
item.description: Please see: https://community.librenms.org/t/large-schema-update-being-released/637 for further info.

item.title: Change to extremeware and xos discovery
item.description: On the 10th of March, we are changing the way that OS detection is done for Extremeware and XOS devices, this could lead to the OS changing so if you have alerting or groups that reference these os names then please be aware that you will need to update them.

item.title: Change to Ubiquiti Airfibre device type
item.description: On the 24th of March, we are changing device type for Ubiquiti AirFibre from network to wireless. See https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/6160 for PR.

item.title: Change to some DNOS discovery
item.description: On the 24th of March, we are changing the detection of some Dell DNOS devices to PowerConnect. This is to show the difference between v6 and v9 of the DNOS OS. See https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/6206 for PR.

item.title: Change to Cisco UCM type from tele to collaboration
item.description: On the 10th of April 2017, we are changing the type Cisco UCM (cucm) devices from tele to collaboration. If you have any alert rules or groups based on this value please adjust them after the daily update on that date.

item.title: Change to AXIS OS device type
item.description: On the 17th of April 2017, we are changing the device type of AXIS devices from network to appliance. If you have any alert rules or groups based on this value please adjust them after the daily update on that date.

item.title: Change to MGE, Eaton, and Powerware UPS os
item.description: On the 24th of April 2017, The following UPS devices os will change: mgeups(Galaxy)->apc-mgeups, mgeups->eaton-mgeups, powerware->eatonups. If you have any alert rules or groups based on this value please adjust them after the daily update on that date.

item.title: Change to IRC alerts
item.description: On the 8th of June 2017, we will change the way the ircbot displays alerts. It will now start using the standard templating system. You can customize the alert templates for irc using e.g. {if %transport == irc}. Please be aware that overly long templates might lead to the bot being disconnected for excess flood.

item.title: Change Cisco Unified CM (cucm) detection to be ucos (Cisco Unified Communication OS)
item.description: On the 17th of June 2017, we are changing the os name of cucm to ucos to be inline with the Cisco name.

item.title: Change Ubiquiti AirOS (airos) device type
item.description: On the 10th of July 2017, we are changing the device type of Ubiquiti AirOS devices from network to wireless. If you have any alert rules or groups based on this value please adjust them after the daily update on that date.

item.title: PowerWalker devices will now use the EPPC MIB for sensors
item.description: On the 20th of July 2017, we are changing the PowerWalker OS to use the EPPC MIB for sensor data. This will bring with it some additional metrics but will also mean that historical graphs will no longer be available. If you require this data then we suggest you copy the rrd files out of the way for later use.

item.title: EricssonLG iPECS devices OS name change
item.description: On the 25th of September 2017, we are changing the OS names for the ELG iPECS UCP from ipecs -> elg-ipecs-ucp and for the ELG iPECS ES from ericsson-es -> elg-ipecs-es. Please adjust any alert rules or device groups that use these OS names.

item.title: Cisco SMB Linux OS changing to Cisco WAP
item.description: On the 27th of October 2017, we are changing the OS names for the Cisco SMB Linux devices from ciscosmblinux -> ciscowap. Please adjust any alert rules or device groups that use these OS names.

item.title: API update will enforce user permissions, check your tokens
item.description: Please see https://community.librenms.org/t/api-update-will-enforce-user-permissions-check-your-api-tokens/2675 for more info

item.title: Cambium Refactor
item.description: On the 6th of December 2017, we are changing the OS names for all Cambium products to their respective category. (Ex: pmp, ptp650, ptp250, cmm) Please adjust any alert rules or device groups that use these OS names. This will bring with it some additional metrics but will also mean that some historical graphs for Cambium devices will no longer be available.

item.title: cometsystem-p85xx OS changing to websensor
item.description: On the 11th of December 2017, we are changing the OS names for cometsystem-p85xx to websenor. Please adjust any alert rules or device groups that use these OS names. This will bring with it some additional metrics.

item.title: Processor Usage Refactor
item.description: February 5th we will merge a major processors rewrite. Most will see no difference, some were fixed. The following will lose historical data: axos, calix, dsm, fiberhome, hbblmos. If you have any issues, please come report in our Discord (https://t.libren.ms/discord). For more details, visit the pull request: https://git.io/vNyUK.

item.title: raritan OS changing to raritan-pdu
item.description: On March 23rd we will merge a pull request which will rename the OS raritan to raritan-pdu. Please adjust any alert rules or device groups that use these OS names.

item.title: aerohive OS changing to hiveos-wireless
item.description: On March 23rd we will merge a pull request which will rename the OS aerohive to hiveos-wireless. Please adjust any alert rules or device groups that use these OS names.

item.title: avaya-ers and avaya-vsp OS' changing to boss and voss.
item.description: On April 12th we will merge a pull request which will rename the OS' avaya-ers and avaya-vsp OS' to boss and voss respectively. Please adjust any alert rules or device groups that use these OS names.

item.title: Manual intervention required for 1.40 update
item.description: When LibreNMS 1.40 is released on Wednesday May 30, there are some steps that need to be taken to restore your Web UI. The poller should continue without interruption. More details here: https://community.librenms.org/t/new-requirements-for-1-40/4057

item.title: Cambium Cleanup
item.description: On Monday the 4th of July 2018, some cambium metrics(CRC errors, fecInErrors, fecOutErrors) are being migrated over to the Wireless Tab, the old data will be available for some time still but will be removed from the Graphs Tab in a future update.

item.title: Calix OS reorganize
item.description: On Monday the 23rd of July 2018, The OS known as calix will be split into calix, exa, and occamos. Please update any device groups or alert rules which may reference this OS. See https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/8832 for more details.

item.title: CMTS OS reorganize
item.description: On Tuesday the 24th of July 2018, the OS known as cmts will be changed to arris-c4. Please update any device groups or alert rules which may reference this OS. See https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/8883 for more details.

item.title: New authentication system
item.description: In ongoing efforts to improve LibreNMS, a new authentication system will be merged on Tuesday the 11th of September 2018. Existing configurations should continue to work. For more details and to test https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/8702

item.title: Pre-checks for 1.44 - Please read
item.description: We haven't yet gone live with 1.44 yet, before we do we want to give you a heads up on things you should check before updating. We've switched out our authentication system over to Laravel + some front end changes mean old setups could have issues. Please have a read of https://community.librenms.org/t/1-44-pre-announcement/5734

item.title: Deprecation of legacy alert transports + legacy templating engine
item.description: This is a notification to inform users that we are deprecating legacy transports and template support in the New Year 2019. Please see https://t.libren.ms/deprecation-alerting for further information.

item.title: Reminder: Deprecation of legacy alert transports + legacy templating engine
item.description: This is a notification to inform users that we are deprecating legacy transports and template support in the New Year 2019. Please see https://t.libren.ms/deprecation-alerting for further information.

item.title: Minimum PHP supported version changing to 7.1.3
item.description: Please note that we will be changing the minimum supported PHP version from 5.6.3 to 7.1.3 on the 1st of Feb 2019. You can read more about this change here: https://t.libren.ms/php7

item.title: Merging ethernetprobe2 into akcp
item.description: On January 15th, 2019 we will merge the ethernetprobe2 os into the akcp os. This will also include improved sensor support.\n\nIf you have any alert rules or device groups that rely on this OS definition then you will need to update those rules to include akcp.
